I would change the assassination of Archduke Franz Ferdinand in Sarajevo in 1914. This event is widely considered to be the catalyst for World War I, and changing it could have a significant impact on the course of history. For example, if Franz Ferdinand had not been assassinated, it is possible that the First World War could have been avoided, and Europe could have remained peaceful.

I would change the outcome of the American Civil War. This would have a huge impact on the history of the United States and the world. For example, if the Confederacy had won the war, the country would have remained divided and slavery would have continued. If the Union had won, the country would have been reunified and slavery would have been abolished.

I would change the outcome of the Cuban Missile Crisis. This would have a huge impact on the world, as it brought the world closer to nuclear war than ever before. If the crisis had been resolved differently, it is possible that the world would have remained peaceful and nuclear weapons would have been eliminated.

I would change the outcome of the French Revolution. This would have a huge impact on the world, as it led to the rise of Napoleon Bonaparte and the spread of French imperialism. If the revolution had been resolved differently, it is possible that Europe would have remained peaceful and the world would have been different.

I would change the outcome of the Cold War. This would have a huge impact on the world, as it led to a long period of tension and competition between the United States and the Soviet Union. If the war had been resolved differently, it is possible that the world would have been more peaceful and cooperative.
